meanings.definition: A rough, knotty protuberance on a tree.
meanings.sent1: The old oak tree had a large gnar on its trunk.
meanings.sent2: I felt the rough gnar on the branch as I climbed the tree.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the gnar as a lookout point for acorns.
meanings.sent4: The gnar on the tree seemed like a natural sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The gnar's twisted shape made it a unique feature of the forest.

meanings.sent1: She would gnar about the rainy weather every day.
meanings.sent2: Please don't gnar about the small inconveniences.
meanings.sent3: He would gnar so much that his friends nicknamed him 'Mr. Gnarly'.
meanings.sent4: The child continued to gnar even after getting what he wanted.
meanings.sent5: Her constant gnarring made the atmosphere gloomy.

meanings.sent1: The dog started to gnar at the stranger approaching the house.
meanings.sent2: The bear gnarred warningly as the hiker got too close.
meanings.sent3: The cat gnarred at the toy mouse, thinking it was real.
meanings.sent4: The dragon's gnar echoed through the cave, sending shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The gnar of the wolf in the distance made the night feel eerie.
